Sri Mulyani Pede Ekonomi RI Tumbuh 5,05% di Kuartal III
01 Nov 2019, 05:30 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Sri Mulyani usai bertemu Jokowi (Andhika Prasetia/detikcom)

Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati masih optimistis pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal III 2019 masih di atas 5% atau sekitar 5,05%. Menurutnya, konsumsi masih bertahan di atas 5%, begitu juga dengan investasi yang di atas 5%."Meskipun investasi kita lihat mengalami sedikit perlambatan kita juga berharap terjaga di atas 5% untuk investasi. Mungkin yang berat adalah eksternalnya, ekspor. Meskipun kemarin sudah menunjukkan ada perbaikan jadi kami tetap optimis kuartal III bisa di atas 5%. Mungkin seperti BKF sampaikan di 5,05%. Jadi mungkin kami tetap di situ," paparnya di Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkeu) Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Disinggung shortfall pajak, Sri Mulyani menuturkan ada beberapa pos penerimaan yang mengalami perlambatan. Namun, Sri Mulyani masih enggan mengungkapkan secara rinci."Kita hitung sampai penerimaan September yang lalu dengan pertumbuhan terutama untuk pajak korporasi dan PPN yang mengalami perlambatan mungkin kita akan tetap, lihat nantilah saya nggak akan sampaikan angkanya," ujarnya.Lanjut Sri Mulyani, defisit anggaran kemungkinan akan mengalami pelebaran. Menurutnya, defisit diperkirakan dalam rentang 2 sampai 2,2% dari produk domestik bruto (PDB)."Tapi defisit akan meningkat seperti yang sudah disampaikan antara 2-2,2% dari GDP, meningkat dari tadinya 1,86%," ujarnya."Jadi kami akan tetap jaga Itu mungkin dari sisi makro lebih baik karena bisa memberikan stimulus, artinya tidak menekan ekonomi dalam situasi mereka sudah mendapat tekanan dari luar," sambungnya.Simak Video "Sri Mulyani Lanjut Jadi Menteri Keuangan RI"[Gambas:Video 20detik](eds/eds)

Sri Mulyani Pede RI's Economy Grows 5.05% in the Third Quarter
01 Nov 2019, 5:30 AM by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Sri Mulyani after meeting Jokowi (Andhika Prasetia / detikcom)

Jakarta - Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati is still optimistic that economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 will still be above 5% or around 5.05%. According to him, consumption still holds above 5%, as well as investments above 5%. "Although we see investment experiencing a slight slowdown, we also expect to be maintained above 5% for investment. Perhaps the weight is external, exports. Although yesterday it was already "There is an improvement so we remain optimistic that the third quarter can be above 5%. Maybe like BKF said at 5.05%. So maybe we will stay there," he explained at the Ministry of Finance (Ministry of Finance) Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019) Regarding the tax shortfall, Sri Mulyani said that there were a number of revenue posts that were slowing down. However, Sri Mulyani was still reluctant to disclose the details. "We counted until the receipt last September with growth, especially for corporate taxes and VAT which experienced a slowdown, maybe we will remain, see later, I will not convey the numbers," he said. Continue Sri Mulyani, the deficit budget is likely to experience widening. According to him, the deficit is estimated in the range of 2 to 2.2% of gross domestic product (GDP). "But the deficit will increase as it has been stated between 2-2.2% of GDP, an increase from 1.86%," he said. "So we will keep on guard. It might be better from a macro perspective because it can provide stimulus, meaning that it does not put pressure on the economy in a situation where they have been under pressure from outside," he continued. ] (eds / eds)
